categories.title: Web Development
categories.description: Websites and miscellaneous projects using web technologies(HTML,CSS,JavaScript). I'm currently working on some backend projects as well, which I'll put up here eventually.

projects.title: Style Stage - Atomic Clock
projects.description: A stylesheet that I contributed to Style Stage: a public CSS showcase maintained by Stephanie Eckles.

projects.title: All The Fishes
projects.description: An animated, interactive virtual fish tank. A project from User Interface Programming at Raritan Valley Community College, with animations using PIXI.js. Fish sprites by Sarah Lopez.

projects.title: Meet The Fishes
projects.description: Animated character bios for "All The Fishes". Fish sprites by Sarah Lopez.

categories.title: Game Development
categories.description: Game prototypes. More finished projects on the way.

projects.title: Climbing Game Prototype
projects.description: A prototype of an infinite climbing game made in Unity. Jump between platforms. Avoid lightning bolts. See how high you can get. A mashup of mechanics from several different example projects from Programming for Game Developers at Raritan Valley Community College.

projects.title: They Keep The Lights On At Night
projects.description: Explore an empty office building at night. Watch out for jumpscares. My final project from Fundamentals of Game Engines at Raritan Valley Community College, and my first major Unity project. The purpose was to learn Unity's various subsystems, so it's not quite fully implemented, but the level can be played all the way through.

projects.title: Bustin' Through
projects.description: A polished prototype of a simple interaction. Smash the glass and breach the reactor core. Why? Why not?

projects.title: Empty Instance
projects.description: One of my first attempts at making a game. A short visual novel about a slightly unhinged conversation between two strangers. Created in Ren'Py.

categories.title: Sketches, Experiments and Toys
categories.description: A mix of old and/or weird projects that I built to test an idea, try a new library or otherwise learn something.

projects.title: 3D Trading Card/Character Sheet
projects.description: This is an animated card component built using CSS. I had originally conceived of this as a concept for a card that could be used in a browser-based character sheet app for tabletop RPGs.

projects.title: CSS "Platform Ticket"
projects.description: A re-creation of a printed "platform ticket" from an event held at the Metropolitan Opera House in the early 19th century. Uses CSS typography, SVG and 9(!) different web fonts.
